intro: Guatteria pogonopus, commonly known as the hairy guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Central America and northern South America, typically found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that ripens to a deep red color. Guatteria pogonopus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
